Package: com.github.jrubygradle

[Groovy] Class JRubyExec

            • com.github.jrubygradle.JRubyExec
            • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
              JRubyExecTraits

              class JRubyExec
extends org.gradle.api.tasks.JavaExec

              Runs a ruby script using JRuby

              Authors:
              Schalk W. Cronj√©

              • Constructor Detail

                • JRubyExec()

              • Method Detail

                • @java.lang.Override org.gradle.api.tasks.JavaExec args(java.lang.Object... args)

                • @java.lang.Override org.gradle.process.JavaExecSpec args(java.lang.Iterable<?> args)

                • @java.lang.Override void exec()

                • @java.lang.Override java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArgs()

                  getArgs gets overridden in order to add JRuby options, script name and script arguments in the correct order. There are three modes of behaviour

                  • script set. no jrubyArgs, or jrubyArgs does not contain -S - Normal way to execute script. A check whether the script exists will be performed.
                  • script set. jrubyArgs contains -S - If script is not absolute, no check will be performed to see if the script exists and will be assumed that the script can be found using the default ruby path mechanism.
                  • script not set, but jrubyArgs set - Set up to execute jruby with no script. This should be a rarely used otion.
                  Throws:
                  org.gradle.api.InvalidUserDataException if mode of behaviour cannot be determined.

                • @java.util.Optional @org.gradle.api.tasks.Input java.util.List<java.lang.String> getJrubyArgs()

                  Returns a list of jruby arguments

                • @org.gradle.api.tasks.Input java.lang.String getJrubyVersion()

                  If it is required that a JRubyExec task needs to be executed with a different version of JRuby that the globally configured one, it can be done by setting it here.

                • @java.util.Optional @org.gradle.api.tasks.Input java.io.File getScript()

                  Script to execute.

                  Returns:
                  The path to the script (or nul if not set)

                • @java.util.Optional @org.gradle.api.tasks.Input java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getScriptArgs()

                  Returns a list of script arguments

                • static java.lang.String jarDependenciesGemLibPath(java.io.File gemDir)

                • void jrubyVersion(java.lang.String ver)

                  Setting the jruby-complete version allows for tasks to be run using different versions of JRuby. This is useful for comparing the results of different version or running with a gem that is only compatible with a specific version or when running a script with a different version that what will be packaged.

                  Parameters:
                  version - String in the form '1.7.13'
                  Since:
                  0.1.18

                • @java.lang.Override org.gradle.api.tasks.JavaExec setArgs(java.lang.Iterable<?> applicationArgs)

                • void setJrubyVersion(java.lang.String version)

                  Setting the jruby-complete version allows for tasks to be run using different versions of JRuby. This is useful for comparing the results of different version or running with a gem that is only compatible with a specific version or when running a script with a different version that what will be packaged.

                  Parameters:
                  version - String in the form '1.7.13'

                • @java.lang.Override org.gradle.api.tasks.JavaExec setMain(java.lang.String mainClassName)

                • static void updateJRubyDependencies(org.gradle.api.Project project)

                  Ensure that our JRuby depedencies are updated properly for the default jrubyExec configuration and all other JRubyExec tasks This function also ensures that we have a proper version of jar-dependencies on older versions of JRuby so jar requires work properly on those version

                  Parameters:
                  project
                  Since:
                  1.0.0

                • void validateTaskConfiguration()

                  Verify that we are in a good configuration for execution
